content: a standard round toe from the sock knitter s handbook p 75 knit until you reach the needle with half your stitches this is now the beginning of your round round 1 needle 1 k1 ssk k to last 3 sts k2tog k1 needle 2 k1 ssk k to end needle 3 k to last 3 sts k2tog k1 round 2 knit repeat rounds 1 and 2 until you have half of the original stitches of your sock 36 stitches repeat round 1 only until you have 20 total stitches remaining on your sock graft the end using kitchener stitch i recommend looking up marly bird s youtube tutorial on how to do the kitchener stitch without having pointy ears on your work doing it this way gives a much more professional finish finishing weave in all ends you can use any method you want to do this i recommend splitting the stitches several times as you weave in and i like to leave a small amount of yarn out which i fray and then use friction to embed it into the sock i find a seam ripper or a sharp needle is very helpful in fraying ends wash and block or do what i do and give them a little steam from the steam iron this will even out your stitches and make the sock look much better in photos or when given as a gift without all the time spent blocking
